spanishExample: ¡Habla de tus hijos, por favor!
englishTranslation: Talk about your children, please!
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"

spanishExample: ¿Cuándo hablarás de lo que hiciste ese día?
englishTranslation: When will you talk about what you did that day?
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
cuándo: adverb meaning "when?" in a question or implied question
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablarás: will speak, you will speak (Hablar, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¿Qué tal el día? Estoy aquí para que hablemos.
englishTranslation: How about the day? I am here so that we talk.
vocabIncluded: hablemos: speak, we speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Ahora hablan de Chicago y lo hacen cada vez más.
englishTranslation: Now they are talking about Chicago and they do it more and more.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablan: speak, they speak (Hablar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Algún día hablaré de eso si tengo algo de tiempo.
englishTranslation: Someday I will talk about that if I have some time.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablaré: will speak, I will speak (Hablar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Alguna tarde hablarán de ese libro del que tú hablaste.
englishTranslation: Some afternoon they will talk about that book about which you talked.
vocabIncluded: "el que" to mean "which" after a preposition
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
hablarán: will speak, they will speak (Hablar, future, 3rd person plural)
hablaste: spoke, you spoke (Hablar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Algunas veces hablas de tus hijos, tienes que hablar de tus hijas.
englishTranslation: Several times you speak about your sons; you have to speak about your daughters.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
hablas: speak, you speak (Hablar, present, 2nd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Cuando hablamos con él esa noche, tenía bastantes cosas.
englishTranslation: When we talked to him that night, he had quite a few things.
vocabIncluded: hablamos: spoke, we spoke (Hablar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Cuando yo hablaba de Uruguay, ellos no estaban ahí.
englishTranslation: When I was talking about Uruguay, they were not there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablaba: was speaking, I was speaking (Hablar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Diana habla de lo que Janet hablaba todo el tiempo en el pasado.
englishTranslation: Diana talks about what Janet was talking all the time in the past.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
habla: speaks, he/she/it speaks (Hablar, present, 3rd person)
hablaba: was speaking, he/she/it was speaking (Hablar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Él habló de eso, y ellos hablaron de la comida.
englishTranslation: He talked about that, and they talked about the food.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablaron: spoke, they spoke (Hablar, preterite, 3rd person plural)
habló: spoke, he/she/it spoke (Hablar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Estoy segura de que no hablaremos de la casa.
englishTranslation: I am sure(f) that we will not talk about the house.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablaremos: will speak, we will speak (Hablar, future, 1st person plural)
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar

spanishExample: Hablé con él de algunos autos; tal vez sea suficiente.
englishTranslation: I talked to him about some cars; perhaps it’s enough.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablé: spoke, I spoke (Hablar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Hable sobre su trabajo porque es muy seguro.
englishTranslation: Talk about your(formal) job because it’s very safe.
vocabIncluded: seguro: adjective meaning "safe" or "secure" when used with Ser

spanishExample: Hay muchos autos y quiero tener alguno.
englishTranslation: There are many cars and I want to have one(some).
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: No hables de eso con ellos porque hay poco tiempo.
englishTranslation: Don’t talk about that with them because there is little time.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hables: speak, you speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: No hemos hablado en tanto tiempo y por tal razón tenemos que hacerlo.
englishTranslation: We have not talked in such a long time and, for that reason we have to do it.
vocabIncluded: hemos: "have", "we have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person plural)
por tal razón: "for such a reason" (idiom)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: No quiero que nadie hable de la luz.
englishTranslation: I don’t want anyone to talk about the light.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hable: speak, he/she/it speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Nunca hablamos de la casa y esta vez quiero que hablemos de eso.
englishTranslation: We never talk about the house and this time I want us to talk about that.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablamos: speak, we speak (Hablar, present, 1st person plural)
hablemos: speak, we speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Para ese día él hablará en español del equipo.
englishTranslation: By that day he will speak in Spanish about the equipment.
vocabIncluded: "para": "by" a moment in time, as in "by then"
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
hablará: will speak, he/she/it will speak (Hablar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quiero que hablen de cualquier lugar.
englishTranslation: I want them to talk about any place.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hablen: speak, they speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Voy a ir para que hables con ella de tal libro.
englishTranslation: I am going to go in order for you to talk with her of such a book.
vocabIncluded: de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
hables: speak, you speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Ya que estamos hablando, me puedes decir qué es eso.
englishTranslation: Since we are talking, you can tell me what that is.
vocabIncluded: "qué" in an implied question, not an actual question
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
ya que: idiom meaning "since" in a logical sense

spanishExample: Yo hablo con mis amigos, pero él no quiere que hable con ellos.
englishTranslation: I talk to my friends, but he doesn’t want me to talk to them.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hable: speak, I speak (Hablar, subjunctive, 1st person)
hablo: speak, I speak (Hablar, present, 1st person)
